tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir Archibald Geikie, delivers an address honoring the memory of numerous distinguished scientists who passed away in the previous year. These scientists contributed significantly to various fields such as biology, geology, physics, astronomy, chemistry, pathology, zoology, botany, and engineering. The address highlights the importance of the Royal Society's work in promoting scientific discovery and understanding.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Obituaries
